body_html: Hi derek At first thank you for your response I ran your script and it's results is : ERROR: Failed to import the TensorFlow module. - Python version is 3.5. - TensorFlow is installed at: C:\Program Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\tensorflow - Could not load 'cudnn64_5.dll'. The GPU version of TensorFlow requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in your %PATH% environment variable. Note that installing cuDNN is a separate step from installing CUDA, and it is often found in a different directory from the CUDA DLLs. You may install the necessary DLL by downloading cuDNN 5.1 from this URL: https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn But as i told you, i downloaded cudnn 5.1 It contains 3 files Cudnn64_5.dll Cudnn.h Cudnn.lib I copied : cudnn64_5.dll to cuda DLLs directory and then added it to windows environment variable PATH Cudnn.h to cuda includes Cudnn.lib to cuda libs/x64 but because of you said , i copied dll file in anaconda3/DLLs Now still i have past problem Image links of errors and directories files : https://ibb.co/bZHkFv https://ibb.co/fbOgoF https://ibb.co/hEUnTF https://ibb.co/kNuhvv https://ibb.co/ivDmNa https://ibb.co/dk2fha https://ibb.co/mCyLha https://ibb.co/cP2P8F Thank you my friend
body_text:
Hi derek
At first thank you for your response
I ran your script and it's results is :

ERROR: Failed to import the TensorFlow module.

- Python version is 3.5.

- TensorFlow is installed at: C:\Program
Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\tensorflow

- Could not load 'cudnn64_5.dll'. The GPU version of TensorFlow
  requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in
  your %PATH% environment variable. Note that installing cuDNN is a
  separate step from installing CUDA, and it is often found in a
  different directory from the CUDA DLLs. You may install the
  necessary DLL by downloading cuDNN 5.1 from this URL:
  https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn

But as i told you, i downloaded cudnn 5.1
It contains 3 files
Cudnn64_5.dll
Cudnn.h
Cudnn.lib

I copied :
cudnn64_5.dll to cuda DLLs directory and then added it to windows
environment variable PATH
Cudnn.h to cuda includes
Cudnn.lib to cuda libs/x64
but because of you said , i copied dll file in
 anaconda3/DLLs
Now still i have past problem
Image links of errors and directories files :
https://ibb.co/bZHkFv
https://ibb.co/fbOgoF
https://ibb.co/hEUnTF
https://ibb.co/kNuhvv
https://ibb.co/ivDmNa
https://ibb.co/dk2fha
https://ibb.co/mCyLha
https://ibb.co/cP2P8F
Thank you my friend
body:
Hi derek
At first thank you for your response
I ran your script and it's results is :

ERROR: Failed to import the TensorFlow module.

- Python version is 3.5.

- TensorFlow is installed at: C:\Program
Files\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\tensorflow

- Could not load 'cudnn64_5.dll'. The GPU version of TensorFlow
  requires that this DLL be installed in a directory that is named in
  your %PATH% environment variable. Note that installing cuDNN is a
  separate step from installing CUDA, and it is often found in a
  different directory from the CUDA DLLs. You may install the
  necessary DLL by downloading cuDNN 5.1 from this URL:
  https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn

But as i told you, i downloaded cudnn 5.1
It contains 3 files
Cudnn64_5.dll
Cudnn.h
Cudnn.lib

I copied :
cudnn64_5.dll to cuda DLLs directory and then added it to windows
environment variable PATH
Cudnn.h to cuda includes
Cudnn.lib to cuda libs/x64
but because of you said , i copied dll file in
 anaconda3/DLLs
Now still i have past problem
Image links of errors and directories files : 
https://ibb.co/bZHkFv
https://ibb.co/fbOgoF
https://ibb.co/hEUnTF
https://ibb.co/kNuhvv
https://ibb.co/ivDmNa
https://ibb.co/dk2fha
https://ibb.co/mCyLha
https://ibb.co/cP2P8F
Thank you my friend
